thread.title: Pilgrims hope pope will help close Gitmo
thread.title_full: Pilgrims hope pope will help close Gitmo | News24

author: news24.com
title: Pilgrims hope pope will help close Gitmo
text:
Holgun - Cubans from Guantanamo province said on Monday they hope Pope Francis's visit to Cuba will help bring an end to the US naval base and detention center at Guantanamo Bay.
Hundreds of residents of Guantanamo city and the eastern province of the same name made the nine-hour bus trip to Holguin to attend the pope's mass here on Monday, the third day of an eight-day trip that will take Francis to both Cuba and the United States.
Many of them voiced hope that the Argentine pontiff, who played a key role in brokering the recent US-Cuban rapprochement, would be able to persuade the United States to give up the Guantanamo Bay naval base on which it holds a permanent lease under a 1903 treaty.
Cuba's communist regime has long demanded the return of the base, especially since the United States began holding detainees there as part of former US president George W Bush's War on Terror following the September 11 2001 attacks.
